events.originalText: The Paris Agreement, under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, came into effect.
events.subtitle: Paris Agreement
events.headline: Paris Agreement comes into effect under UN Framework Convention on Climate Change

events.originalText: In the first aviation incident involving an Airbus A380, Qantas Flight 32 suffered an uncontained engine failure and made an emergency landing at Changi Airport in Singapore with no casualties.
events.subtitle: Aviation accidents and incidents
events.headline: Qantas Flight 32 makes emergency landing in Singapore after engine failure

events.originalText: Barack Obama (pictured) became the first African American to be elected President of the United States.
events.subtitle: Barack Obama
events.headline: Barack Obama elected as first African American President of the United States

events.originalText: Israeli prime minister Yitzhak Rabin was assassinated by Yigal Amir, a right-wing extremist, at a peace rally at Kings of Israel Square in Tel Aviv.
events.subtitle: Yitzhak Rabin
events.headline: Israeli PM Yitzhak Rabin assassinated at peace rally in Tel Aviv

events.originalText: Authorities in California discovered a 13-year-old feral child, pseudonymously known as Genie, who had spent nearly her entire life in social isolation.
events.subtitle: Feral child
events.headline: Authorities discover 13-year-old feral child Genie in California

events.originalText: Ayatollah Khomeini was arrested by SAVAK and secretly exiled to Turkey.
events.subtitle: Ruhollah Khomeini
events.headline: Ayatollah Khomeini arrested and exiled to Turkey by SAVAK

events.originalText: Robert A. Lovett, United States Secretary of Defense, issued a memorandum establishing the National Security Agency, with responsibility for all communications intelligence for the government.
events.subtitle: Robert A. Lovett
events.headline: National Security Agency established by US Defense Secretary Robert A. Lovett

events.originalText: Second World War: Allied forces completed Operation Pheasant, a major operation to clear German troops from the province of North Brabant in the Netherlands.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allied forces complete Operation Pheasant in the Netherlands during WWII

events.originalText: The Hlinka Guard and Slovakian police began the deportation of several thousand Jews from the country.
events.subtitle: Hlinka Guard
events.headline: Hlinka Guard and Slovakian police begin deportation of Jews

events.originalText: The tomb of Tutankhamun (pictured) was discovered by a team led by British Egyptologist Howard Carter.
events.subtitle: Tomb of Tutankhamun
events.headline: Tomb of Tutankhamun discovered by British Egyptologist Howard Carter

events.originalText: The remains of an unknown soldier were buried with an eternal flame at the Altare della Patria (pictured) in Rome.
events.subtitle: Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Italy)
events.headline: Unknown soldier buried with eternal flame at Altare della Patria in Rome

events.originalText: The keel of USS Nevada was laid down, beginning construction on the United States Navy's first "super-dreadnought".
events.subtitle: Keel
events.headline: Construction begins on USS Nevada, US Navy's first super-dreadnought

events.originalText: London's City and South London Railway, the first deep-level underground railway in the world, officially opened, running a distance of 3.2 mi (5.1 km) between the City of London and Stockwell.
events.subtitle: City and South London Railway
events.headline: London's first deep-level underground railway opens between City of London and Stockwell

events.originalText: American Civil War: Nathan Bedford Forrest led a cavalry division in an attack on a Union Army supply base at Johnsonville, Tennessee, resulting in the capture of 150 prisoners.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Nathan Bedford Forrest leads attack on Union Army base in Tennessee during Civil War
